data.name: A Tome of Battle
entries: A common complaint about martial combat in D&D is the gulf of power and utility that opens up between the warrior and the mage. While the wizard, cleric, and druid learn world-altering spells, the fighter swings his sword a few more times. Moreover, the metanalysis of weapon combat is largely solved, to the detriment of most of the weapon list. The tools in this document attempt to provide warriors with meaningful choices, options, and incentives to act outside 'I attack.' This is primarily a 'gamist' document, so while flavor elements are considered, it does not claim to fix combat to some imagined realistic or historical standard, or expand the weapon list for its own sake.
Each set of rules is presented ala carte, so a DM may wish to make available only some of these pages or powers.

The vanilla weapon list has duplication and weapons with no obvious value. The revised weapons table attempts to make a wider range of weapons compelling to warriors with varying properties and weapon-specific techniques reflecting specialized training in each weapon's unique advantages, without increasing the ceiling of martial damage.

In 5E (and previous editions!), combat actions are often locked behind feats, which come around just every four levels, and compete with critical ability score improvements. The Combat Actions and Hit Die Actions section moots certain weak feats (Charger, Grappler) with situational actions, codifies DMG object damage guidelines for combat, and adds ways to do non-magical healing and status effect actions, expending hit dice instead of spell slots.

Stances, an innovation in the 3E Tome of Battle, were an attempt to provide martial characters with passive bonuses during combat. Combat Stances replace 5E's Fighting Style feature with dynamic stances inspired by Unearthed Arcana and the Tome of Battle, advanced stances to provide a sense of progression, and rules for changing stances mid-combat.

There might be concerns that additional maneuvers step on the Battlemaster's toes, but the Battlemaster adds effects and damage to his weapon attacks, while these techniques and special actions are used to as a substitute for an attack or action. For example, any character can Disarm, but only the Battlemaster can Disarming Attack. The final section vastly expands Battlemaster maneuvers with specializations - Cut-Throat, Mystic Knight, Savage, or Warlord - that represent a different approach to battlefield superiority, plus a standard maneuver group. Other fighters can gain limited access to these maneuvers, including more powerful techniques with level prerequisites to create a sense of progression.

entries: Extra Attack grants a Combat Stance only if the PC has the {@variantrule Combat Stances|marpro} feature. Ability Score Improvement grants a Weapon Technique only if the PC is proficient with all martial weapons or has the Pact of the Blade or Path of the Kensei feature.
New and weapons with modified properties are italicized.

entries: Weapons with modified properties are denoted with an asterisk (*). New weapons are {@i italicized}.

entries.name: Backswing
entries: When you make a weapon attack with this weapon and miss, you make the next attack with this weapon on this turn with advantage.

entries.name: Bandoleer
entries: When making a thrown weapon attack, you draw the weapon from an appropriate container or case as part of the attack.

entries.name: Bladed
entries: The damage type of this weapon is piercing or slashing (your choice).

entries.name: Covert
entries: If you are hidden, a missed ranged attack does not reveal your location.

entries.name: Entrapping
entries: When you want to catch and restrain a weapon in combat, you can use the {@action Attack} action to make a special melee attack, an entrapment attempt with this weapon. If you have multiple attacks as part of the {@action Attack} action, this replaces one of them. The target of your entrapment must be within the reach of your weapon and wielding a melee or ranged weapon.

Make a Dexterity ({@skill Sleight of Hand}) check contested by the target's Strength ({@skill Athletics}) or Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) (its choice). A creature wielding a weapon in two hands has advantage on this check, and a creature larger than you automatically wins. If you win, the target can't make attacks with the entrapped weapon until the entrapment ends.

You can't move out of your weapon's range, make an attack with the entrapping weapon, or drop your own weapon without releasing the entrapped weapon, which you can do at any time. If the target moves or is moved outside your weapon's reach, the entrapment ends and you can use your reaction to attempt to {@action Disarm|marpro} it (pg. 5) with advantage on your attack roll to do so.

entries.name: Escaping an Entrapment
entries: A creature can use its action to attempt to free its entrapped weapon by making a Strength ({@skill Athletics}) or Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) check contested by your Dexterity ({@skill Sleight of Hand}).

entries.name: Heavy
entries: A heavy weapon's size or mass make it difficult to use without counterbalancing weight. Small and Tiny creatures have disadvantage on attack rolls with heavy weapons as if using a weapon sized for a larger attacker {@book (DMG pg. 278)|DMG|9|Creating a Monster}. Small and Tiny creatures may craft versions of these weapons that are more suited to them, with the size of all damage dice reduced by 2 (e.g. 1d10 becomes 1d8, 2d6 becomes 2d4, etc.).

entries.name: Reserve
entries: Attacking with this weapon from a {@condition prone} position does not impose disadvantage on the attack roll.

entries.name: Siege
entries: This weapon deals double damage to structures and objects that are not worn or carried.

data.name: Additional Combat Actions
entries: This section is intended to provide rules for characters to access conditions and effects that are otherwise only adjudicated by DM rulings, such as restraining a spellcaster or executing a prisoner. Some of these actions are intended to replace weaker combat feats or features, such as {@feat Charger}, {@feat Grappler}, or Berserker's {@subclassFeature Intimidating Presence|Barbarian||Berserker||10}. Others are alternatives to actions that become less attractive to martial characters with multiple attacks.

Some actions in this section utilize hit dice as a resource (marked with an asterisk), and a DM may want to disallow them; these powerful actions may grant excessive resources to a party that has fewer encounters and short rests per day.

data.name: Weapon Techniques
entries: When a class or feature grants you general proficiency with martial weapons, or you choose the Pact of the Blade or Way of the Kensei, you can choose to learn a technique that takes advantage of the properties of a weapon or family of weapons, as given on the table below. Afterward, you learn one additional weapon technique of your choice each time you gain an Ability Score Improvement.
At your DM's discretion, you can learn a new technique by spending a number of downtime days equal to 10 minus your Intelligence modifier training with an appropriate expert.

When a technique requires a saving throw, the DC is 8 + your weapon attack bonus. A technique can only be used while wielding a weapon in its list, and when a technique allows you to make an attack, you must do so with a weapon in its list, unless otherwise noted. When a technique deals damage to a creature, you can add any appropriate magical bonus from your weapon to the damage roll.

When a technique is used as a special melee attack, it must replace the attack granted by the {@action Attack} action. If you have multiple attacks as part of the {@action Attack} action, the technique replaces one of them.

data.name: Combat Stances
entries: Stances were originally presented in the Book of Nine Swords for Third Edition, granting certain classes powers that continually boost a warrior's abilities. Fifth Edition uses some of this concept in Fighting Styles, available to most martial classes, and this document replaces those features with the following:

entries.name: Combat Stance
entries: {@i Replaces Fighting Style}

You adopt a particular style of fighting with the flexibility to shift your stance, flowing seamlessly between offense and defense. Each time you gain this feature, you learn two stances of your choice from the below list. After this, each time you gain Extra Attack or an improvement to Extra Attack, you learn one additional stance of your choice.
When you gain a level, you can replace one stance you know with another one, if you meet its requirements.

You can enter or change stance when you roll initiative, or as a bonus action on your turn, choosing from your stances known. You can maintain only one stance at a time, and you lose any stance bonus while incapacitated.

entries.name: Hybrid Stance
entries: {@i Replaces {@subclassFeature Additional Fighting Style|Fighter||Champion||10}}
At 10th level, you can enter and maintain two stances at the same time. In addition, you learn two stances of your choice.

entries.name: Feat: Fighting Initiate
entries: {@feat Fighting Initiate|marpro}

entries.name: Basic Stances
entries: The stances listed below have no prerequisites.

entries.name: Advanced Stances
entries: To learn or use one of these stances, you must meet the prerequisites listed. An advanced stance improves a basic stance, granting both its benefits and that of the basic stance that it references.

data.name: Maneuvers Expanded
entries: These combat maneuvers are intended to supplement the ones provided in the PHB for Battlemasters. The {@subclassFeature Battle Master|Fighter||Battle Master||3||Battlemaster} Archetype replaces the PHB Combat Superiority feature with the below feature. By taking {@optfeature Specialized Technique|marpro} (pg. 11) as an alternative to taking a Fighting Style or Combat Stance, Superior Technique grants a measure of Battlemaster prowess to any warrior.

entries.name: Combat Superiority (Revised)
entries: {@i Replaces {@subclassFeature Battle Master|Fighter||Battle Master||3||Combat Superiority}}

When you choose this archetype at 3rd level, you learn maneuvers that are fueled by special dice called superiority dice. Choose a specialization - {@filter Cut-Throat|optionalfeatures|feature type=CM:C}, {@filter Mystic Knight|optionalfeatures|feature type=CM:M}, {@filter Savage|optionalfeatures|feature type=CM:S}, or {@filter Warlord|optionalfeatures|feature type=CM:W} - which you cannot change later, reflecting the style of your battlefield superiority.

{@b Maneuvers.} You learn four maneuvers of your choice, which are detailed below, that must be chosen from your specialization or the {@filter Combat Maneuvers|optionalfeatures|feature type=CM} group. If a maneuver has prerequisites, you must meet the requirements to choose or use it. Many maneuvers enhance an attack in some way; if so, you can use only one maneuver per attack. Other maneuvers replace an attack or action. If such a maneuver requires an attack roll, you can add any magical bonuses from your weapon to the damage roll.
You learn two additional maneuvers of your choice at 7th, 10th, and 15th level. At the end of a long rest, you can replace one maneuver you know with a different eligible one.

{@b Superiority Dice.} You have four superiority dice, which are {@dice d8}s. A superiority die is expended when you use it. You regain all of your expended superiority dice when you finish a short or long rest. You gain another superiority die at 7th and at 15th level.
{@b Saving Throws.} Some of your maneuvers require your target to make a saving throw to resist the maneuver's effects. The saving throw DC is calculated as follows:
{@b Maneuver save DC} = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength or Dexterity modifier (your choice)

entries.name: Superior Technique
entries: {@i Replaces {@feat Martial Adept}}

Choose a specialization - {@filter Cut-Throat|optionalfeatures|feature type=CM:C}, {@filter Mystic Knight|optionalfeatures|feature type=CM:M}, {@filter Savage|optionalfeatures|feature type=CM:S}, or {@filter Warlord|optionalfeatures|feature type=CM:W} - if you do not have one already. You learn two maneuvers from your chosen specialization or the {@filter Combat Maneuvers|optionalfeatures|feature type=CM} group, following the rules above except as modified below. If a maneuver has prerequisites, you must meet the requirements to choose or use it.
You gain two superiority dice, which is a {@dice d4}s (these dice are added to any superiority dice you have from another source) and does not change size as you gain levels.
If you gain this feat or feature again, you learn two additional maneuvers from your specialization or the Combat Maneuvers group, and gain two additional d4 maneuver dice.

Unless you also have {@variantrule Maneuvers Expanded|marpro|Combat Superiority}, you cannot replace maneuvers gained from this feature at the end of a long rest. Instead, when you gain a level, you can replace one maneuver you know with a different eligible maneuver from your specialization or the Combat Maneuvers group.

entries.name: Ki-Fueled Technique
entries: {@i Optional 11th-level monk feature }

Your focused training has resulted in secret, deadly techniques. You gain the {@variantrule Maneuvers Expanded|marpro|Superior Technique} feature, but do not gain any superiority dice. When you use a maneuver gained from this feature, roll your martial arts die instead of a superiority die. You can't use stunning strike on an attack caused or affected by a maneuver.

You can use a maneuver granted by this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier, and regain all uses when you finish a long rest. While you have no uses available, you can spend 1 ki point to use a maneuver again.

entries.name: Roguish Technique
entries: {@i Optional 7th level rogue feature}

You've learned a few fighting tricks. Whenever your sneak attack bonus would increase by {@dice 1d6}, you can choose to instead gain the {@variantrule Maneuvers Expanded|marpro|Superior Technique} feature.

entries.name: Raging Technique
entries: {@i Optional 9th level barbarian feature }

Your combat style is unrefined but effective. Whenever your rage damage bonus would increase by 1, you can choose to instead gain the {@variantrule Maneuvers Expanded|marpro|Superior Technique} feature.

entries.name: Backswing
entries: When you make a weapon attack with this weapon and miss, you make the next attack with this weapon on this turn with advantage.

entries.name: Bandoleer
entries: When making a thrown weapon attack, you draw the weapon from an appropriate container or case as part of the attack.

entries.name: Bladed
entries: The damage type of this weapon is piercing or slashing (your choice).

entries.name: Covert
entries: If you are hidden, a missed ranged attack does not reveal your location.

entries.name: Entrapping
entries: When you want to catch and restrain a weapon in combat, you can use the {@action Attack} action to make a special melee attack, an entrapment attempt with this weapon. If you have multiple attacks as part of the {@action Attack} action, this replaces one of them. The target of your entrapment must be within the reach of your weapon and wielding a melee or ranged weapon.

Make a Dexterity ({@skill Sleight of Hand}) check contested by the target's Strength ({@skill Athletics}) or Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) (its choice). A creature wielding a weapon in two hands has advantage on this check, and a creature larger than you automatically wins. If you win, the target can't make attacks with the entrapped weapon until the entrapment ends.

You can't move out of your weapon's range, make an attack with the entrapping weapon, or drop your own weapon without releasing the entrapped weapon, which you can do at any time. If at any time the target is no longer within your weapon's reach, the entrapment ends.

entries.name: Escaping an Entrapment
entries: A creature can use its action to attempt to free its entrapped weapon by making a Strength ({@skill Athletics}) or Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) check contested by your Dexterity ({@skill Sleight of Hand}).

entries.name: Heavy
entries: A heavy weapon's size or mass make it difficult to use without counterbalancing weight. Small and Tiny creatures have disadvantage on attack rolls with heavy weapons as if using a weapon sized for a larger attacker {@book (DMG pg. 278)|DMG|9|Creating a Monster}. Small and Tiny creatures may craft versions of these weapons that are more suited to them, with the size of all damage dice reduced by 2 (e.g. 1d10 becomes 1d8, 2d6 becomes 2d4, etc.).

entries.name: Reserve
entries: Attacking with this weapon from a {@condition prone} position does not impose disadvantage on the attack roll.

entries.name: Siege
entries: This weapon deals double damage to structures and objects that are not worn or carried.

baseitem.name: Cestus
entries: The cestus, or brass knuckles, are any striking glove or weapon that protects the hand while adding power to strikes. Claw weapons may deal slashing or piercing damage instead. Add the cestus to the monk weapons list {@book (PHB pg.78)|PHB|3}.

entries.name: Special
entries: Your attacks with this weapon are also considered to be unarmed strikes.

entries.name: Special
entries: You have disadvantage when you use a lance to attack a target within 5 feet of you. Also, a lance requires two hands to wield when you aren't mounted.

baseitem.name: Saber
entries: A curved, single-edged sword often used as a sidearm.

baseitem.name: Swordbreaker
entries: A dagger with a series of hooked, horizontal notches opposite the blade, used to catch and entrap the opponent's weapon.

baseitem.name: War Whip
entries: A reinforced whip, juijieban, kusarigama, meteor hammer, or other martial variant of the whip.

baseitem.name: Greatbow
entries: A greatbow is a massive arc of sturdy wood, much larger than a typical longbow, with draw weight beyond the strength of most men. It cannot be used while mounted, and readying or stowing it uses your bonus action or action, instead of an object interaction. Creatures with less than 15 Strength make attacks with the greatbow with disadvantage, while creatures with less than 11 strength cannot draw it at all.

entries.name: Special
entries: You add your Strength modifier instead of your Dexterity modifier to your greatbow damage roll.

entries.name: Special
entries: A Large or smaller creature hit by a net is {@condition restrained} until it is freed. A net has no effect on creatures that are formless, or creatures that are Huge or larger. A creature can use its action to make a DC 10 Strength check, freeing itself or another creature within its reach on a success. Dealing 5 slashing damage to the net (AC 10) also frees the creature without harming it, ending the effect and destroying the net. When you use an action, bonus action, or reaction to attack with a net, you can make only one attack regardless of the number of attacks you can normally make.

action.name: Castle
entries: As an action, you can move into the space of a willing creature within 5 feet of you, moving the creature into the space you previously occupied. You must both fit in the space available. Neither you nor the target provoke opportunity attacks for this movement.

action.name: Charge
entries: You can use your momentum to enhance your rushing attack. When you (or your mount) uses an action to Dash and you move at least 10 feet in a straight line towards a creature, you can make one melee attack against it as a bonus action. If you hit, you can choose to push the creature 5 feet away from you. Hit or miss, your speed becomes 0 until the end of your turn.

action.name: Disarm
entries: DMG pg. 271 ({@action Disarm|dmg}) revised

You can use a weapon attack to knock a weapon or another item from a target's grasp by making an attack roll contested by the target's Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check or Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) check (its choice). If you win, the attack causes no damage or other ill effect, but the defender drops the item at your feet. Items that are worn or attached cannot be disarmed.

You have disadvantage on your attack roll if the target is holding the item with two or more hands. The target has advantage on its ability check if it is larger than you, or disadvantage if it is smaller.

action.name: Distraction
entries: When you take the {@action Attack} action, you can replace one of your weapon attacks with a move that puts an enemy off-balance. Make a Dexterity ({@skill Sleight of Hand}) check against the Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) check of a creature within 5 feet of you. If you win this check, the creature cannot take reactions until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Overrun / Tumble
entries: DMG pg. 272 ({@action Overrun|dmg} / {@action Tumble|dmg}) revised

When you try to move through a hostile creature's space, you can try to force through by overrunning the creature. As an action or bonus action, make a Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check contested by the creature's Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check. You have advantage on your roll if you are larger than the creature, or disadvantage if you are smaller. If you win, you can move through (but not end your turn in) the hostile creature's space once on this turn.

Alternatively, you can attempt to duck, dodge, and weave past the hostile creature. As an action or bonus action, make a Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) check contested by the creature's Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) check. If you win, you can move through (but not end your turn in) the hostile creature's space once this turn. If the creature wins, it can use its reaction to attempt to {@action shove} you {@condition prone}.

action.name: Seize
entries: While grappling a target that is your size or smaller, you can attempt to pin it with an additional free hand. As a special melee attack, make another {@action grapple} check. If you win, both you and the target are {@condition restrained} until the grapple ends, and you can choose one of the following additional effects:

items: You maneuver to the target's side or back. While {@condition restrained}, the creature cannot attack you.
You pin the target's hands and arms. While {@condition restrained}, the creature cannot cast a spell with a somatic component, draw a non-light weapon, or take the {@action Use an Object} action.

You cover the target's mouth and muffle its speech. While {@condition restrained}, the creature cannot be heard clearly beyond 15 feet, or at all beyond 30 feet. If the creature attempts to cast a spell with a verbal component, it must make a Dexterity saving throw against a DC of 8 + your Strength modifier. On a failed saving throw, the spell fails but the spell slot is not lost.

entries: A creature can be subject to only one of these effects from each creature grappling it.

action.name: Sunder
entries: {@book (DMG pg. 246)|DMG|8|Objects}, extended

When you use your action to {@action attack} a creature with a melee weapon, you can attempt to break a weapon, shield, armor, or object the target is wearing or holding. The attack roll is made against the object's AC, plus the Dexterity modifier and any circumstantial or magical bonuses to AC of the creature holding or wearing it. The object has three-quarters cover if it is not being held, and you have disadvantage on the attack roll if the object is more than one size smaller than the target.

On a hit, you deal damage to the object. If the object is reduced to 0 hit points, it is broken and can't be used in a normal fashion until it is repaired. The AC of sundered armor is reduced by 2 instead. An item can be repaired via magic or by spending 1 hour using an appropriate set of tools, possibly requiring part of the item's value in raw materials.

The hit points and AC of an object are subject to your DM's discretion, with some guidelines provided here and in the DMG. Most creatures wield weapons and shields that are small, resilient objects with 11 ({@dice 3d6}) hit points, while most medium-sized armor has 5 ({@dice 1d8}) hit points for each point of AC above 10. Most leather or wood objects have 15 AC and iron or steel objects have 19 AC. Most adventuring equipment has resistance to nonmagical damage and immunity to psychic and poison damage. Magical weapons or objects may be immune to sundering damage.

action.name: Tackle
entries: You charge an opponent, attempting to subdue it using your momentum and weight. When you use your action to {@action Dash} and you move at least 10 feet in a straight line towards a creature, you can attempt to {@action grapple} or {@action shove} it as a bonus action. If you win the opposed check, the target is knocked {@condition prone} and either {@condition grappled} or pushed 5 feet (your choice). Otherwise, the target is unaffected. In either case, you are knocked {@condition prone} and your speed becomes 0 until the end of your turn.

action.name: Coup de Grace
entries: As an action, you attempt to finish a helpless opponent, one that is {@condition unconscious}, {@condition paralyzed}, or otherwise rendered unable to take actions or use movement (the {@condition incapacitated} condition is necessary but not sufficient). You deal an automatic critical hit with a melee attack (no attack roll needed). If the creature survives the damage, it must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against a DC equal to 10 or half your damage roll, whichever is higher. On a failure, it dies. A rogue applies sneak attack damage when delivering a coup de grace.
Delivering a coup de grace provokes opportunity attacks from creatures within 5 feet of you and reduces your speed to 0 until the end of the turn.

action.name: First Aid
entries: As an action, you bind wounds and apply simple first aid with a {@item Healer's Kit|phb}. Expend a use of the kit and make a DC 10 Wisdom ({@skill Medicine}) check targeting a creature within five feet of you that has less than half its maximum number of hit points. On a success, the target can choose to expend one hit die as if it did so during a short rest, plus one additional die for each 5 points you exceed the DC. If the creature's current hit points exceed half of its maximum hit points after expending a die, it cannot expend any more dice, even if your check result would allow it to do so.

action.name: Heroic Resolve
entries: When you make a death saving throw, you can expend and roll a hit die, adding the result to your roll. You must choose to do so before making the roll. If you roll a 1 on the {@dice d20} but the total result would succeed, the roll counts as one failure instead of two.
You gain a level of exhaustion, and recover one fewer hit die (minimum zero) at the end of your next long rest.

action.name: Knockout Blow
entries: Once per turn, when you hit a surprised or {@condition restrained} creature with a bludgeoning attack, you can try to knock it out. Roll your damage as normal, but instead of taking damage the creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against a DC equal to 10 or half your damage roll, whichever is higher, or it is rendered {@condition unconscious} for 1 minute. The target awakens if it takes damage or another creature uses an action to wake it. This ability has no effect on constructs and undead.

action.name: Hurl
entries: If you are grappling a target your size or smaller, you can exert yourself in an attempt to hit it with the ground. As a special melee attack, expend one or more hit dice, up to a number equal to your Strength modifier. You sling the creature 5 feet away from you and it must make a Dexterity saving throw against a DC equal to 8 + your Strength ({@skill Athletics}) modifier, or it is thrown an additional 5 feet per hit die expended and lands {@condition prone}.
The creature takes bludgeoning damage equal to your Strength modifier, plus {@damage 1d4} for each 5 feet it was thrown.

action.name: Sprint
entries: Pushing yourself to go slightly faster, you overexert yourself while moving into or out of danger. When you use your action or bonus action to Dash, you can expend a hit die and move just a bit farther, gaining an amount of speed equal to 5 x half the die roll (rounded up) until the end of your turn.
You cannot use this ability if your speed has been reduced by an effect or condition..

action.name: Terrorize
entries: You can use your action to frighten someone with your presence. Choose one creature within 15 feet of you that can see or hear you. It must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw (DC equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Charisma or Strength modifier) or be {@condition frightened} of you until the end of your next turn. On subsequent turns, you can use your action to extend the duration of this effect on the {@condition frightened} creature until the end of your next turn. This effect ends if the creature ends its turn out of line of sight or more than 60 feet away from you. If the creature succeeds on its saving throw or the {@condition frightened} condition ends, you cant use this feature on that creature again for 24 hours.
A 10th level barbarian who follows the {@subclassFeature Path of the Berserker|Barbarian||Berserker||3} can initiate or extend this ability as a bonus action.

table.name: Weapon Techniques Reference Table
table.caption: Weapon Techniques Reference Table
rows: Glaive, Handaxe, Saber, Shortbow, Sickle, War Whip, Whip
Halberd, Lance, Pike, Spear, Trident, War Whip
Any Improvised, Cestus, Dagger, Handaxe, Shortsword
Flail, Light Hammer, Mace, Maul, Warhammer
Battleaxe, Cestus, Club, Dagger, Flail, Greatclub, Mace, Maul, Morningstar, Sickle, Warhammer
Cestus, Club, Greatclub, Light Hammer, Mace, Sling
Halberd, Lance, Pike, Quarterstaff, Rapier, Spear, Trident
Any Bow, Dagger, Dart, Handaxe, Javelin, Heavy or Light Crossbow
Greataxe, Halberd, Quarterstaff, Spear, Trident, War Whip

optionalfeature.name: Abwenden
entries: A fencing parry, warding off a blow using your own blade. When a creature hits you with a melee weapon and you are not wielding any other weapon or a shield, you can use your reaction to make an attack roll. If the result equals or exceeds the triggering attack roll, the attack misses, unless it is a critical hit.

optionalfeature.name: Bleeder

item: Glaive, Handaxe, Saber, Shortbow, Sickle, War Whip, Whip

entries: When an attack roll with this weapon exceeds the target's AC by 5 or more, or on a critical hit, the weapon inflicts a bleeding wound. A bleeding creature takes 3 slashing damage at the beginning of each of its turns, ending when it receives magical healing or a creature uses an action to make a DC10 Wisdom ({@skill Medicine}) check to stop the flow of blood.
A creature can have only one bleeding wound at a time.

optionalfeature.name: Bracing

item: Halberd, Lance, Pike, Spear, Trident, War Whip

entries: You know how to set your weapon to add power to your defensive strikes. When you make a melee attack using a readied action and hit a creature that has moved at least ten feet on this turn, add an additional weapon die to the damage roll and the target must make a Strength saving throw. On a failure, it falls {@condition prone} and, if mounted, falls from its mount.

optionalfeature.name: Cleave
entries: Once on your turn in place of a two-handed melee attack, you can strike at multiple creatures using a single massive swing. Each targeted creature must be within 5 feet of you and one other target, and you can choose a number of targets up to your proficiency bonus.
Each target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, it takes slashing damage equal to {@damage 1d4} plus your Strength modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Close Quarters

item: Any improvised, Cestus, Dagger, Handaxe, Shortsword

entries: When you successfully {@action grapple} or escape a grapple, you can make one weapon attack as a bonus action. When an opponent fails to escape your grapple, you can make a weapon attack as a reaction.

optionalfeature.name: Crippling Cut
entries: As a special melee attack, you aim for a vulnerable limb with a precise strike. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take slashing damage equal to your Strength modifier and have one form of speed (such as walking or flying) reduced by 10 feet (to a minimum of 0). This effect ends when the creature is healed or spends one turn without using any movement.

optionalfeature.name: Crushing Blow

item: Flail, Light Hammer, Mace, Maul, Warhammer

entries: You can shatter armor with massive swings. Either by using both an action and bonus action, or in place of two weapon attacks, you can make a single attack roll against a heavily- or naturally-armored enemy within reach. On a hit, you deal your normal weapon damage and the target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw. If it fails, its AC is reduced by 2 until the armor is repaired using an action, or, if it has natural armor, until the creature receives healing. This ability is ineffective against magical armor and constructs.
A creature's AC can't be reduced this way more than once.

optionalfeature.name: Entangle
entries: You can make a {@action disarm|marpro}, {@action grapple}, {@action shove}, or {@action shove|phb|trip} attack while up to 10 feet from your target by using the extra reach of your weapon. Your reach for the {@condition grappled} condition when using this weapon is 10 feet instead of 5 feet. If you successfully {@action shove} a creature using this weapon, you can choose to either push the target five feet away or pull the target five feet closer.

If you {@action grapple} at range, you can't use the weapon to attack or drop the weapon, or the grapple ends. Either combatant can use an action to make an opposed Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check; the winner can choose to pull the loser up to 5 feet closer. If one creature is larger than the other, it has advantage on this check.

optionalfeature.name: Finisher

item: Battleaxe, Cestus, Club, Dagger, Flail, Greatclub, Mace, Maul, Morningstar, Sickle, Warhammer

entries: As a melee attack, you can forgo advantage on an attack roll to attempt to execute a {@condition prone} or {@condition incapacitated} creature. If your attack roll exceeds the creature's remaining hit points, the target's hit points are reduced to zero. If not, but the attack hits, you deal damage as normal.

optionalfeature.name: Flexible Flurry
entries: When you wield a versatile weapon and make a weapon attack using one hand, you gain advantage on your next {@action grapple} check, unarmed strike, or weapon attack using two hands on this turn.

optionalfeature.name: Grazing Clout

item: Cestus, Club, Greatclub, Light Hammer, Mace, Sling

entries: When an attack roll with this weapon misses the target's AC by 4 or less, the bludgeon still connects, if not as powerfully. The target takes bludgeoning damage equal to the weapon's damage die

optionalfeature.name: Iaijutsu
entries: You can draw this weapon from a scabbard without using your object interaction, if you then immediately make an attack with it.
If you have multiple attacks as part of the {@action Attack} action, you can make those multiple attacks when you use a {@action ready|phb|readied} action, instead of making a single attack.

optionalfeature.name: Lunge

item: Halberd, Lance, Pike, Quarterstaff, Rapier, Spear, Trident

entries: When wielding this weapon, you can use a bonus action to extend yourself in a lunging strike. You gain 5 feet of reach for your next attack.

optionalfeature.name: Paired Weapon
entries: While you wield both this weapon and a non-light weapon, you gain a +1 bonus to your AC. Once per turn, you can choose to add {@damage 1d4} to the damage roll of your other weapon. When you do so, you lose the bonus to AC until the beginning of your next turn, unless you have the {@feat Dual Wielder} feat.

optionalfeature.name: Piercing Strike
entries: As a special melee attack, you can attempt to penetrate and damage an opponent's heavy or natural armor. The target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, it takes piercing damage equal to your Strength modifier and its AC is reduced by 1 until its armor is repaired, or in the case of natural armor, the creature receives healing. This ability is ineffective against magical armor and constructs.
A creature's AC can't be reduced this way more than twice.

optionalfeature.name: Pinning Shot

item: Any Bow, Dagger, Dart, Hand axe, Javelin, Heavy or Light Crossbow

entries: As an action, you can attempt to pin a Large or smaller creature that is within normal range of your weapon, sticking it to the ground or other terrain. A creature that is immune to the {@condition prone} condition, or currently flying or swimming, is unaffected. Otherwise, the target must succeed on a Strength or Dexterity saving throw (its choice) or one form of its speed (walking, flying, or swimming) is reduced to 0 until the end of its next turn. As an action, the creature can pull free and regain its normal speed.

optionalfeature.name: Shattering Clobber
entries: If you are using an improvised weapon that deals bludgeoning damage or a nonmagical weapon listed above, you can use a weapon attack to strike beyond the limits of your tool, with such force that the weapon breaks. The target must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, it takes bludgeoning damage equal to a critical hit with your weapon and your weapon is rendered broken and useless.

optionalfeature.name: Shield Bash
entries: As a special melee attack, you drive an opponent off-balance by smashing through their guard with your shield. The target must succeed on a Strength saving throw or it takes bludgeoning damage equal to your Strength modifier and your next attack roll against it this turn has advantage.

optionalfeature.name: Split Shot
entries: Once per turn in place of a ranged weapon attack, you nock two pieces of ammunition and fire them at different targets you can see within 5 feet of each other. Make a ranged attack against each target; if either attack misses, both do. Otherwise, you deal your weapon damage to each target.

optionalfeature.name: Suppressing Fire
entries: You fire a projectile near but not at an opponent, diverting its attention to you. As an action, expend a piece of ammunition to force a creature within 30 feet to make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, it has disadvantage on attack rolls that don't target you until the end of its next turn, unless you are more than 30 feet away from it.

optionalfeature.name: Whirling Rebuff

item: Greataxe, Halberd, Quarterstaff, Spear, Trident, War Whip

entries: As a special melee attack, you brandish your weapon to drive opponents away, up to a number of targets equal to your proficiency bonus. Each target must be within 5 feet from you and one other target. A targeted creature must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be pushed 5 feet in a direction of your choice.

optionalfeature.name: Archery (Soaring Raptor)
entries: You gain a +2 bonus to attack rolls with ranged weapons.

optionalfeature.name: Blind-Fighting (Setting Sun)
entries: Being unable to see a creature within 30 feet of you doesnt impose disadvantage on your attack rolls against it or grant advantage on its attack rolls against you, provided the creature isnt hidden from you.

optionalfeature.name: Bulwark (Stonefoot Stance)
entries: When you end your turn without using more than 5 feet of movement, you gain temporary hit points equal to your proficiency bonus and have advantage on your Strength and Constitution checks and saving throws. These effects, including any remaining temporary hit points, end at the beginning of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Defense (Iron Heart)
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to AC.

optionalfeature.name: Devoted Spirit
entries: You inspire vigor and raise morale in your allies. Once per turn when you hit a hostile creature with a melee attack, a creature you choose, other than you, within 30 feet of you gains temporary hit points equal to your Charisma modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Druidic Warrior
entries: You learn two cantrips from the {@filter druid spell list|spells|level=0|class=druid}, which you can cast only while in this stance. They count as ranger spells for you, and Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for them. Whenever you gain a ranger level, you can replace one of these cantrips with another cantrip from the druid spell list.

optionalfeature.name: Double Striking (Thicket of Blades)
entries: When you engage in two-weapon fighting, you can add your ability modifier to the damage of the additional attack.

optionalfeature.name: Dueling (Desert Wind)
entries: When you are wielding a melee weapon that does not have the heavy property and no other weapon, apply a +2 bonus to damage rolls with it.

optionalfeature.name: Great Weapon Fighting (Stone Dragon)
entries: When you roll a 1 or 2 on a damage die for an attack you make with a melee weapon that you are wielding with two hands, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll, even if the new roll is a 1 or a 2. The weapon must have the two-handed or versatile property for you to gain this benefit.

optionalfeature.name: Interception (Phalanx of Steel)
entries: When a creature you can see hits a target, other than you, within 5 feet of you with an attack, you can use your reaction to reduce the damage the target takes by {@dice 1d10} + your proficiency bonus (to a minimum of 0 damage). You must be wielding a shield to use this reaction.

optionalfeature.name: Savagery (Raging Demon)
entries: Once per turn when you hit with a melee weapon attack, you can choose to roll each of your damage dice twice and take the higher result of each die.

optionalfeature.name: Skirmishing (Zephyr Dance)
entries: Your movement increases by 5 feet. The first 5 feet of movement you use each turn does not provoke opportunity attacks.

optionalfeature.name: Specialized Technique
entries: You gain the {@variantrule Maneuvers Expanded|marpro|Superior Technique} feature (pg.12) instead of a stance, if you are using both {@variantrule Combat Stances|marpro} and {@variantrule Maneuvers Expanded|marpro}. You can choose this feature only once.

optionalfeature.name: Thrown-Weapon Fighting (Rabid Wolf)
entries: When you hit with a ranged attack using a thrown weapon, add {@damage 1d4} to the weapon damage roll.

optionalfeature.name: Unarmed Fighting (Tiger Claw)
entries: You can roll a {@damage d6} in place of the normal damage of your unarmed strikes. If you strike with two free hands, the {@damage d6} becomes a {@damage d8}.
At the start of your turn, you can choose to deal bludgeoning damage equal to your Strength modifier to one creature you are {@condition grappled|phb|grappling}.

optionalfeature.name: Vanguard (White Raven)
entries: When you hit a creature with a melee attack, the next attack roll against that creature made by someone other than you has advantage. You must remain within 5 feet of the creature to grant this benefit.

optionalfeature.name: Bastion
entries: When you gain temporary hit points from the Bulwark stance, you also gain a damage threshold of 10 against nonmagical bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage until the start of your next turn (damage you take that is equal or less than your damage threshold is reduced to 0).

optionalfeature.name: Diamond Mind
entries: While you are Blind-Fighting, you can use your reaction to add your proficiency bonus to any Wisdom saving throw you make that does not already use your proficiency bonus.

optionalfeature.name: Elder Mountain
entries: While in the Defense stance, you gain an additional +1 bonus to your AC.

optionalfeature.name: Enfilade
entries: While in the Vanguard stance, if you attack a creature that has not made an attack roll since the beginning of its last turn, you make your attack roll with advantage.

optionalfeature.name: Fencing
entries: While Dueling, your weapon damage die increases by one size (e.g. from a {@dice d8} to a {@dice d10}), to a maximum of {@dice d12}.

optionalfeature.name: Protection
entries: While in the Interception stance and wielding a shield, you can use your reaction to grant yourself, or a creature within 5 feet of you, resistance to the damage of an effect that forces the target to make a Dexterity saving throw.
If you have the {@feat Shield Master} feat, you add your {@item shield}'s bonus to AC to all Dexterity saving throws, whether the effect targets only you or includes other creatures.

optionalfeature.name: Pugilism
entries: When you are Unarmed Fighting and make an unarmed strike with one hand, you can make an unarmed strike or grapple check as a bonus action.

optionalfeature.name: Reprisal
entries: If a creature hits you with a melee weapon while you are in Skirmishing stance, you can use your reaction to make a melee attack against it with a weapon that doesn't have the heavy property.

optionalfeature.name: Swarming
entries: While in the Double Striking stance, you can make the additional attack of two-weapon fighting as part of your {@action Attack} action instead of as a bonus action. If you do so, you can't use your bonus action to make any attack on that turn.
When you hit with an opportunity attack while wielding two weapons, you can add your second weapon's damage die to the damage roll.

optionalfeature.name: Absolute Territory
entries: As an action, you expend a superiority die and begin a combat patrol or overwatch, establishing area denial. Until the start of your next turn, creatures provoke a special opportunity attack from you when they move 5 feet or more while within 30 feet of your current position.

You get a special reaction that you can take once on every creatures turn, until the start of your next turn. You can only use this special reaction to either make a ranged weapon attack or to move up to half your speed without provoking opportunity attacks and make a melee weapon attack, and you cant use it on the same turn that you take any other reaction. You must target the triggering creature with this attack, and if you hit, you can use your superiority die in place of your weapon's damage die.

optionalfeature.name: Breaking the Wall
entries: As a bonus action, you focus briefly to battle beyond the limits of your endurance. Expend one hit die and recover two superiority dice, up to your maximum number of superiority dice.

optionalfeature.name: Dazing Blow
entries: When you hit a creature with an unarmed strike, you can expend a superiority die to add it to your damage roll and force the target to make a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, it can either use an action or move on its next turn, but not both.

optionalfeature.name: Disarming Attack
entries: When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can expend one superiority die to attempt to disarm the target, forcing it to drop one item of your choice that it's holding. You add the superiority die to the attack's damage roll, and the target must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, it drops the object you choose. The object lands at its feet.

optionalfeature.name: Feinting Attack
entries: You can expend one superiority die and use a bonus action on your turn to feint, choosing one creature within 5 feet of you as your target. You have advantage on your next attack roll this turn against that creature. If that attack hits, add the superiority die to the attack's damage roll.
The advantage is lost if not used on the turn you gain it.

optionalfeature.name: Goading Attack
entries: When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can expend one superiority die to attempt to goad the target into attacking you. You add the superiority die to the attack's damage roll, and the target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target has disadvantage on all attack rolls against targets other than you until the end of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Lunging Attack
entries: Before you make a melee weapon attack on your turn, you can expend one superiority die to increase your reach by 5 feet until the end of your turn. If you hit with this attack, add your superiority die to the attacks damage roll.

optionalfeature.name: Parry
entries: When you are hit by an attack, you can use your reaction and expend a superiority die to add it to your AC until the end of this turn, potentially causing the attack to miss.

optionalfeature.name: Perfect Rush
entries: You prepare a flawless combination of strikes. As an action, expend a superiority die and begin concentrating (as if on a spell). For one minute or until your concentration ends, add your superiority die to your weapon damage rolls.

optionalfeature.name: Precision Attack
entries: When you make a weapon attack roll against a creature, you can expend one superiority die to add it to the roll. You can use this maneuver before or after making the attack roll, but before any effects of the attack are applied.

optionalfeature.name: Punishing Strike
entries: Before you roll damage for a weapon attack, you can expend a superiority die to add it to your damage roll and maximize one damage die of your choice, treating the die as if you rolled its maximum value. On a critical hit, you maximize two dice of your choice.

optionalfeature.name: Rain of Feathered Death
entries: As an action, expend a superiority die and make one attack with a ranged weapon against creatures of your choice within a 10 foot radius of a point you choose within 60 feet. If you hit, your superiority die replaces your usual weapon die.
At 15th level, the radius expands to 20 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Pushing Attack
entries: When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can expend one superiority die to attempt to drive the target back. You add the superiority die to the attack's damage roll, and if the target is Large or smaller, it must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, you push the target up to 15 feet away from you.

optionalfeature.name: Reactive Strike
entries: As a reaction to a creature moving into the reach of your weapon, you can expend a superiority die and make a melee attack against it. On a hit, you deal additional damage equal to your die result and the creature loses 10 feet of movement (to a minimum of zero).
At 10th level, the movement loss increases to 20 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Slayer's Rampage
entries: Armies fall before your blade. As an action, you can expend a superiority die and gain the benefit of a Disengage action. Choose any number of creatures, up to the die result plus your proficiency bonus, provided that you move within 5 feet of each targeted creature on this turn. Each target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, it is reduced to 0 hit points, unless it has a Challenge Rating greater than half your proficiency bonus (rounded down). Such a creature, or one that succeeds on its saving throw, is unaffected.

optionalfeature.name: Strikes of Steel Wind
entries: As an action, you vanish to strike like the wind. Choose creatures you can see within 30 feet of you, up to a number equal to your proficiency bonus, and expend a superiority die. Make one attack against each target, using your superiority die in place of your usual weapon die.
You then teleport to an unoccupied space you can see within 5 feet of one of the targets.

optionalfeature.name: Sweeping Attack
entries: When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, you can expend a superiority die to damage other creatures with the same attack. Choose any number of other creatures, up to your proficiency bonus, within your weapon's range. Each target takes damage equal the number you roll on your superiority die in the same type dealt by the original attack.

optionalfeature.name: Tactical Assessment
entries: When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, you can expend one superiority die to attempt to damage another creature with the same attack. Choose another creature within 5 feet of the original target and within your reach. If the original attack roll would hit the second creature, it takes damage equal to the number you roll on your superiority die. The damage is of the same type dealt by the original attack.

optionalfeature.name: Tripping Attack
entries: When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can expend one superiority die to attempt to knock the target down. You add the superiority die to the attack's damage roll, and if the target is Large or smaller, it must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, you knock the target {@condition prone}.

optionalfeature.name: Wind Slash
entries: You strike in a blur. As an action, expend a superiority die and teleport to an unoccupied space you can see up to 30 feet away. Each creature in a straight line between your initial and final position must make a Dexterity saving throw or take your superiority die in damage of your weapon's type.
At 15th level, the range of this ability becomes 60 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Alternative Medicine
entries: As a bonus action, you expend a superiority die while binding the wounds of yourself or another. The target regains hit points equal to your die roll, and can choose to expend a hit die to regain additional hit points, as if it had done so during a short rest. After a creature benefits from this effect, it cannot do so again until it finishes a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Ambush
entries: When you make a Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) check or an initiative roll, you can expend one superiority die and add the die to the roll, provided you aren't {@condition incapacitated}.

optionalfeature.name: Cunning Strike
entries: When you make a weapon attack with advantage and hit, you can expend any number of superiority dice to deal additional damage equal to the die result(s) plus your Dexterity modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Dirty Trick
entries: As an action, you can expend a superiority die to force a creature within 5 feet of you to make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the creature takes your superiority die in bludgeoning or piercing damage (your choice) and is blinded until the end of its next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Disrupting Strike
entries: When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can expend a Superiority die to add it your damage roll. If the attack forces the target to make a Constitution saving throw to maintain concentration, it takes a penalty equal to the die result on its roll.

optionalfeature.name: Evasive Footwork
entries: When you move, you can expend one superiority die, rolling the die and adding the result to your AC until the end of your turn. If you take the {@action Dash}, {@action Disengage}, or {@action Dodge} action, the bonus instead lasts until the start of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Flash of Steel
entries: As a bonus action, you can expend one superiority die and make one attack with a light weapon that has the thrown property, drawing it from an appropriate container. Add your superiority die to the attack roll.

optionalfeature.name: Mugging
entries: Immediately after you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack on your turn, you can expend a superiority die and use a bonus action to make a Dexterity ({@skill Sleight of Hand}) check against the target's Wisdom ({@skill Perception}), with a bonus equal to your superiority die. On a success, you steal or plant a small object on their person, such as a coin purse or bottle.

optionalfeature.name: Silencing Strike
entries: When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can expend a superiority die to inhibit its ability to speak or shout. Add your superiority die to the damage roll, and the creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be unable to speak clearly beyond 10 feet, or cast a spell with a verbal component, until the end of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Smash and Grab
entries: Immediately after you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack on your turn, you can expend one superiority die and use a bonus action to attempt to {@action grapple} the target with a free hand. Add your superiority die to your Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check.

optionalfeature.name: Snipe
entries: As a bonus action, you can expend a superiority die to carefully aim, giving yourself advantage on your next ranged attack. If you hit, add your superiority die to the damage roll.

optionalfeature.name: Spider Dance
entries: As part of your movement, you can expend a superiority die and gain a climb speed equal to your walking speed until the end of your turn. If you make a Strength check related to climbing on this turn, add your superiority die to the roll.
As a reaction to being knocked {@condition prone}, you can expend a superiority die and stand up, reducing any damage taken by the die result plus your Dexterity modifier (to a minimum of 0 damage).

optionalfeature.name: Venomous Strike
entries: As a bonus action, you can expend one superiority die to coat a melee weapon, or up to three pieces of ammunition, with a poison, venom or toxin that you have on your person. The next attack you make with the envenomed weapon deals additional poison damage equal to your superiority die.

optionalfeature.name: Arcanist's Eye
entries: When you make a Intelligence ({@skill Religion}) or Intelligence ({@skill Arcana}) check, you can expend a superiority die and add the die roll to the result.

optionalfeature.name: Airborne Spellstrike
entries: As a bonus action, you can expend a superiority die and lift yourself off the ground briefly. You gain a flying speed equal to your walking speed until the end of your turn. If you hit with the next weapon attack you make this turn, add your superiority die to the damage roll. If you end your turn in the air, you float safely downward a distance up to your speed, then fall any remaining distance to the ground.

optionalfeature.name: Branding Spellstrike
entries: When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can expend a superiority die and release divine energy. Your attack deals your superiority die in extra radiant damage to the target, which becomes visible if it's invisible, and the target sheds dim light in a 5-foot radius until the end of your next turn.
At 10th level, the target emits light for one minute.

optionalfeature.name: Chilling Spellstrike
entries: When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, you can use a bonus action to expend a superiority die and release painful frost in a 15 foot cone that emanates from you and includes the target. Any creature in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw or take cold damage equal to your superiority die.
At 10th level, a creature that fails the saving throw loses ten feet of speed (minimum zero) until the end of its next turn. At 15th level, this ability releases a 30 foot cone.

optionalfeature.name: Enfeebling Spellstrike
entries: When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, you can use a bonus action to expend a superiority die and release negative energy. The attack deals extra necrotic damage equal to your superiority die to the target, and the target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or it deals only half damage with weapon attacks that use Strength until the end of its next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Flickering Defense
entries: You can use a bonus action to partially blink through the ethereal plane, expending a superiority die. Until the start of your next turn, when you are hit by an attack, roll your superiority die. On a 1 or 2, you take damage as usual. On any other result, you gain resistance to the triggering damage.

optionalfeature.name: Ground Eruption
entries: As an action, you can expend a superiority die and cause an earth shockwave in a straight line 30 feet long and 5 feet wide. The area affected becomes difficult terrain, and any creature in the area must succeed on a Strength saving throw or take your superiority die in bludgeoning damage.
At 10th level, you affect a 30 foot line that is 10 feet wide. At 15th level, the line becomes 15 feet wide.

optionalfeature.name: Ignited Spellstrike
entries: When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can use a bonus action and expend a superiority die to set it aflame. The target takes fire damage equal to your superiority die and must make a Dexterity saving throw or be set aflame for one minute. At the start of each of its turns, the creature takes fire damage equal to your superiority die, ending when it uses an action to put out the flame or is otherwise doused.

optionalfeature.name: Lesser Regeneration
entries: When you expend a hit die to recover hit points, you can expend a superiority die to add it to the number of hit points you recover. If you do so during a short rest, you do not recover this superiority die at the end of that short rest.

optionalfeature.name: Salamander Charge
entries: When you {@action Dash} as an action, you can expend a superiority die to ignite the ground at your feet. You gain the benefit of a {@action Disengage} action, and a 5-foot wide wall of shimmering, spectral fire appears behind you, along the path you take. Any other creature within 5 feet of the wall at the start of its turn must make a Dexterity saving throw or take your superiority die in fire damage. If a creature enters the wall for the first time on a turn, it takes your superiority die in fire damage. The flames are extinguished at the start of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Shocking Spellstrike
entries: When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can expend a superiority die and release a burst of static. You deal extra lightning damage equal to your superiority die and the target cannot take reactions until the start of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Thunderclap Rush
entries: When you take the {@action Attack} action, you can use a bonus action to charge a melee weapon with sonic energy and expend a superiority die. Each time you hit with the weapon during this action, all creatures in a 10 foot cube originating from you and including the creature must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes thunder damage equal to your superiority die and is pushed 5 feet away from you. On a success, a creature takes no damage and is not pushed. Each thundering burst makes a loud noise audible up to 100 feet away.

optionalfeature.name: Unstable Emanation
entries: Choose a damage type - acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder - and expend a superiority die as a bonus action. Until the end of your turn, your weapon attacks deal damage of the chosen type instead of their usual damage type, and you add your superiority die to your next damage roll on this turn.

optionalfeature.name: Crippling Strike
entries: When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, you can expend a superiority die to inflict a lingering injury. It must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be maimed in one of the following ways (your choice):

items: If the creature attacks more than once on its turn, it takes a penalty to its damage rolls equal to your superiority die on all attacks after the first, to a minimum of 0 damage.
A form of the creatures speed (e.g. walking or flying) is reduced by an amount equal to 10 feet plus twice your superiority die (to a minimum of 0 speed).

entries: At the end of each of its turns, the creature can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on a success.

optionalfeature.name: Earthshaking Slam
entries: As an action, you expend a superiority die and generate a shockwave around yourself by slamming the ground. Each creature within 10 feet of you must make a Strength saving throw, or it takes bludgeoning damage equal to your superiority die and is knocked {@condition prone}. A target that succeeds on its saving throw takes no damage and is unaffected.
When you take damage from falling, you can use this ability as a reaction, centered on where you land. You gain resistance to the triggering damage and don't fall {@condition prone}.
At 15th level, the radius of your slam increases to 20 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Feral Senses
entries: When you make a Wisdom ({@skill Survival}) or Wisdom ({@skill Medicine}) check, or a Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) check that relies on hearing or smell, you can expend a superiority die and add the die roll to the result.

optionalfeature.name: Heroic Might
entries: You can expend a superiority die to perform a momentary feat of strength beyond that of ordinary men. Add your die roll to your Strength for the purposes of determining how far or high you can jump, or how much weight you can lift, carry, push, or throw. This temporary Strength lasts until you finish the feat (such as leaping a crevasse), or one minute, whichever is shorter.
Alternatively, you can use this maneuver to add your superiority die to a Strength check.

optionalfeature.name: Juggernaut Charge
entries: When you take the {@action Dash} action, you can expend a superiority die and move in a straight line through any number of creatures your size or smaller, as long as you have movement to do so. Each time you enter a creature's space, it can use its reaction to move 5 feet into an empty space. If it cannot or does not move, it takes your superiority die plus your Strength modifier in bludgeoning damage. At the end of this charge, you lose any remaining movement.
You cannot move into a creature's space if you do not have enough movement to exit its space.

optionalfeature.name: Mighty Throw
entries: When you successfully {@action grapple} a creature your size or smaller and have an additional free hand, or lift an object using your action, you can choose to expend a superiority die to hurl it, sending it airborne in a direction of your choice up to 5 feet times the die result. The target takes {@damage 1d4} bludgeoning damage for each 10 feet it is thrown, halved if it succeeds on a Dexterity saving throw. If the thrown creature or object would hit another creature, that creature must also make a Dexterity saving throw, or it takes half damage. A thrown creature takes damage as if it were thrown the full distance, even if its flight is stopped by a wall, object, or creature.
At 15th level, add your Strength modifier to the die result when calculating how far you can throw an object or creature.

optionalfeature.name: Menacing Attack
entries: When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can expend one superiority die to attempt to frighten the target. You add the superiority die to the attack's damage roll, and the target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, it is {@condition frightened} of you until the end of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Packleader's Howl
entries: Roaring with rage, you inspire your allies to greater ferocity. As a bonus action, choose a number of other creatures up to your proficiency bonus within 30 feet who can hear you, and expend a superiority die. If an affected creature hits with its next attack before the start of your next turn, add your superiority die to its damage roll.

optionalfeature.name: Provoking Taunt
entries: As a bonus action, you expend one superiority die and goad your enemies. Choose a number of creatures within 30 feet that can hear you, up to your proficiency bonus. Each target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or take a penalty equal to your superiority die on all attack rolls against targets other than you until the start of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Savage Constitution
entries: If, at the start of your turn, you are under an effect that causes the {@condition charmed}, {@condition frightened}, or {@condition poisoned} condition, or that allows you to make a saving throw at the end of each of your turns to end it, you can immediately expend a superiority die to make a saving throw against the original save DC, ending the effect on a success. Add your superiority die to the roll.

optionalfeature.name: Shake It Off
entries: When you make a an ability check to defend against a {@action grapple}, or a saving throw against an effect that subjects you to the {@condition grappled}, {@condition prone}, {@condition restrained}, or {@condition stunned} condition, you can expend one superiority die and add the die roll to your check or saving throw.

optionalfeature.name: Steelskin
entries: When you are hit by an attack, you can use your reaction to expend a superiority die and reduce the damage by the die roll plus your Constitution modifier, to a minimum of zero.

optionalfeature.name: Sundering Strike
entries: When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, you can use a bonus action to expend a superiority die and damage natural or worn armor. Add the die to the damage roll, and the target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, its AC is reduced by by 1 until the damage can be repaired with appropriate armorer's tools. In the case of natural armor, the AC reduction ends when the creature receives magical healing equal to your superiority die size. A creature's AC cannot be reduced below 10 + its Dexterity modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Battle Relief
entries: As part of your movement into the space of a willing creature within 5 feet, you can move it into the space you previously occupied and expend a superiority die. Until the start of your next turn, the ally gains a bonus to AC equal to the die result. You must both fit in the space available, and neither you nor the target provoke opportunity attacks for this movement.

optionalfeature.name: Commander's Strike
entries: When you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn, you can forgo one of your attacks and use a bonus action to direct one of your companions to strike. When you do so, choose a friendly creature who can see or hear you and expend one superiority die. That creature can use its reaction to make one weapon attack, adding your superiority die to the attack's damage roll.
At 10th level, you no longer expend your bonus action when you use this maneuver.

optionalfeature.name: Coordination
entries: On your first turn of combat, you can use your bonus action and expend a superiority die to issue tactical orders to your allies. Roll the die and distribute bonuses to initiative to any number of other creatures that can hear you, up to a total bonus equal to the die roll plus your Charisma modifier.
After doing so, reorder initiative. If a creature's new initiative is now higher than yours, it is placed in the initiative order immediately after you.

optionalfeature.name: Distracting Strike
entries: When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can expend one superiority die to distract the creature, giving your allies an opening. You add the superiority die to the attack's damage roll. The next attack roll against the target by an attacker other than you has advantage if the attack is made before the start of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Inciting Strike
entries: When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can expend a superiority die to create an opening for your allies. Add the die to your damage roll, and until the start of your next turn, attack rolls against the creature are considered one higher for the purposes of determining whether or not the result is a critical hit. This effect ends if the creature takes a critical hit as a result of this modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Inspiring Cry
entries: As a reaction to a creature within 30 feet of you making an attack, you can choose another maneuver you know that is triggered by your attack or hit and apply it to their attack or hit. If the maneuver rolls a superiority die, halve the die result (rounding down).

optionalfeature.name: Maneuvering Attack
entries: When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can expend one superiority die to maneuver one of your comrades into a more advantageous position. You add the superiority die to the attack's damage roll, and you choose a friendly creature who can see or hear you. That creature can use its reaction to move up to half its speed without provoking opportunity attacks from the target of your attack.

optionalfeature.name: Phalanx Formation
entries: You can use an action to put your allies in order, bolstering their defenses. Expend and roll a superiority die. Until the start of your next turn, you and your allies gain a bonus to AC and Dexterity saving throws equal to the die result while within ten feet of you.
At 15th level, the range of this ability increases to 20 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Rally
entries: On your turn, you can use a bonus action and expend one superiority die to bolster the resolve of one of your companions. When you do so, choose a friendly creature who can see or hear you. That creature gains temporary hit points equal to the superiority die roll + your Charisma modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Riposte
entries: When a creature misses you with a melee attack, you can use your reaction and expend one superiority die to make a melee weapon attack against the creature. If you hit, you add the superiority die to the attack's damage roll.

optionalfeature.name: Silver-Tongued
entries: When you make a Charisma ({@skill Intimidation}), a Charisma ({@skill Performance}), or a Charisma ({@skill Persuasion}) check, you can expend one superiority die and add the superiority die to the ability check.

optionalfeature.name: War Master's Charge
entries: When you {@action Dash} as an action, you can expend a superiority die to inspire others to join your avalanche of steel. Choose a number of allied creatures who can hear you, up to 1 plus your Charisma modifier, and designate a creature you can see as a target. Each ally can use its reaction to move up to its speed towards the target and make one melee attack, adding your superiority die to its attack roll. This movement must be in the most direct, safe path available. If the target is slain, you can designate a new target for any remaining allies.

optionalfeature.name: Word of Authority
entries: When you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn, you can forgo one of your attacks to inspire your allies. Expend a superiority die and choose a creature other than yourself within 30 feet of you that can hear you. That creature gains an inspiration die of equal size to your superiority die, which acts identically to that granted by the {@classFeature Bardic Inspiration|Bard||1||bard feature (PHB pg. 53)}.

feat.name: Fighting Initiate
entries: Your martial training has helped you develop a particular style of fighting. As a result, you learn one {@filter Basic Stance of your choice from the fighter class|optionalfeatures|Feature Type=CS:F}. When you reach a level that grants the Ability Score Improvement feature, you can replace this feat's stance with another Basic Stance.

items: Choose a specialization - {@filter Cut-Throat|optionalfeatures|feature type=CM:C}, {@filter Mystic Knight|optionalfeatures|feature type=CM:M}, {@filter Savage|optionalfeatures|feature type=CM:S}, or {@filter Warlord|optionalfeatures|feature type=CM:W} - if you do not have one already. You learn two maneuvers from your chosen specialization or the {@filter Combat Maneuvers|optionalfeatures|feature type=CM} group, following the rules above except as modified below. If a maneuver has prerequisites, you must meet the requirements to choose or use it.
You gain two superiority dice, which is a {@dice d4}s (these dice are added to any superiority dice you have from another source) and does not change size as you gain levels.
If you gain this feat or feature again, you learn two additional maneuvers from your specialization or the Combat Maneuvers group, and gain two additional d4 maneuver dice.

Unless you also have {@variantrule Maneuvers Expanded|marpro|Combat Superiority}, you cannot replace maneuvers gained from this feature at the end of a long rest. Instead, when you gain a level, you can replace one maneuver you know with a different eligible maneuver from your specialization or the Combat Maneuvers group.
